scenarios.intro: You're in a big pot with the nut flush draw on the turn. Villain bets 75% pot and you know shoving is +EV.
scenarios.situation_context: Pot: 150BB | Your stack: 100BB | Villain covers you

choices.label: Min-Raise
choices.description: Build the pot but keep options open

scenarios.explanation: If you've identified a +EV spot, fear shouldn't stop you. Calling or folding gives up equity. Min-raising is the worst of both worlds.
scenarios.emotional_lesson: Fear is information, not instruction. Acknowledge it, then execute your strategy.

scenarios.intro: It's your first time at $5/$10. The players seem tougher than your usual $2/$5 game.
scenarios.situation_context: Bankroll: 30 buy-ins for this stake | First orbit | You feel nervous

choices.label: Play Extra Tight
choices.description: Only play premium hands until you settle in

scenarios.explanation: If you have the bankroll and skills, play your game. Being extra tight or aggressive are fear-based adjustments. Leaving before trying isn't growth.
scenarios.emotional_lesson: Growth happens outside comfort zones. Trust your preparation.
